findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled, the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `setFee` function and set both the `_redisFeeOnBuy` and `_taxFeeOnBuy` or `_redisFeeOnSel` and `_taxFeeOnSelll` to the value of 25.

findings.title: DKO - Delete Keyword Optimization
findings.description: The contract resets variables to the default state by setting the initial values. Setting values to state variables increases the gas cost.

findings.title: FSA - Fixed Swap Address
findings.description: The swap address is assigned once and it cannot be changed. It is a common practice in decentralized exchanges to create new swap versions. A contract that cannot change the swap address may not be able to catch up to the upgrade.

findings.title: FRV - Fee Restoration Vulnerability
findings.description: The contract demonstrates a potential vulnerability upon removing and restoring the fees. This can occur when the fees have been set to zero, leading to unintended consequences such as incorrect fee calculations or unexpected behavior within the contract.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.
